fun.connor.lighter.adapter

Interface TypeAdapter<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type supported by this TypeAdaptor
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GsonTypeAdapter

    public interface TypeAdapter<T>
    Basic interface for classes that provide serialization and deserialization. TypeAdaptoes are normally expected to support both serialization and deserialization of their specialized type. However, TypeAdapter implementations can choose to throw a TypeMarshalException for any reason, including unsupported operations.

    TypeAdapters are expected to handle error cases. TypeAdapter implementations should never assume that serialized data provided to them is correct.

    TypeAdapters for type-parameterized objects like collections are expected to work for the erasure of the provided type. For example, a TypeAdaptor for List<String> is expected to support any List instance, whether or not the list contains strings.

    In the future, this interface will contain methods for serializing and deserializing directly from input and output streams.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T deserialize(java.lang.String serializedData)
      Deserialize an object from a string.
      java.lang.String serialize(T type)
      Serialize an object to a String.

    • Method Detail

      • serialize

        java.lang.String serialize(T type)
                    throws TypeMarshalException
        Serialize an object to a String.
        Parameters:
        type - an instance of T to serialize
        Returns:
        the provided instance, serialized to a string
        Throws:
        TypeMarshalException - if any unrecoverable error occurs during execution

      • deserialize

        T deserialize(java.lang.String serializedData)
       throws TypeMarshalException
        Deserialize an object from a string. This method should never assume the serializedData is a correct serialized instance of T.
        Parameters:
        serializedData - An instance of T encoded as a String
        Returns:
        The provided instance as a Java object
        Throws:
        TypeMarshalException - if any unrecoverable error occurs during execution
